channel.title: Port forwarding with a dynamic ip?
channel.description: Is there a program that will forward my ports automatically when I get a new ip? Somebody I know suggested dynip but it's like $70 a year, unless anyone here has a cracked version?

item.title: Port forwarding with a dynamic ip?
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

Crap. Looks like I’m back at square 1 with either myself or my router doing something wrong

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding with a dynamic ip?
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

For just portforwarding you should only need your internal ip, that won’t change.

Read full topic
item.source: Port forwarding with a dynamic ip?

item.title: Port forwarding with a dynamic ip?
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

tbh I have no idea how it works, but I tried forwarding my ports and it doesn’t work. I looked for a guide on portforward.com and other than telling me what I already did, it said to get a static ip - which my isp wants me to pay for. Since it said I need a static ip, I assume a dynamic ip will not work.

Read full topic
item.source: Port forwarding with a dynamic ip?

item.title: Port forwarding with a dynamic ip?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Why would it be any different port forwarding with a dynamic IP compared to a static one?
